page.title: 09FARMING RAFFORD AREA
page.content: Much of the farmland that we saw was given over to grass for grazing cattle.Hay was grown to feed the cattle in winter months.At one of the farms we visted pure bred Aberdeen Angus cattle are kept and the farmers sell them for breeding purposes.Some sheep are also grazed and many farmers grow turnips to help feed the sheep. The most popular crop is barley which is turned into malt and used for making whisky in the many distilleries in the surrounding areas. A few hectares are under oats.A few potatoes are grown for local markets.We did not find much fruit being grown although one farmer had a few hectares of strawberries which he sold locally.One farmer buys lime and stores it in a barn then sells it to surrounding farmers.
